definition: meager/slight/weak/ungenerous or unkind/frivolous/to despise/to belittle/to look down on/to approach or near

sentences.english: In construction site, air is thin, oxygen is lack and it is very cold.
sentences.chinese: 施工區空氣稀薄，嚴重缺氧，氣候寒冷。

sentences.english: Well what is the baby missing when it is first born that causes the hair to be so thin?
sentences.chinese: 嬰兒剛出生時體內少了哪種元素，導致了頭髮稀薄呢？

sentences.english: The ring itself is tenuous, made up of a thin array of ice and dust particles.
sentences.chinese: 環本身是脆弱的，由稀薄的冰和塵埃粒子陣組成。

sentences.english: OH1 Control System for Heavy-duty, Lean-burn, Natural Gas Engines.
sentences.chinese: oh1控制系統的重型，稀薄燃燒，天然氣發動機。

sentences.english: The air was thin and harsh to breathe.
We should wait until the mist thins before driving on.
sentences.chinese: 我們應當等晨霧變得稀薄了以後再開車前進。

sentences.english: The days grow shorter, the air is crisp, and home is where I want to be to relax.
sentences.chinese: 白天變得越來越短，空氣稀薄，而我最想在家中放鬆。

sentences.english: Thin is a term used to describe a wine lacking in body, almost watery.
sentences.chinese: 形容紅酒缺乏質感，很稀薄，幾乎是水狀的。

sentences.english: And now the magic of Potter-mania is slowly disappearing into thin air.
sentences.chinese: 現如今，哈里的魔法熱正逐漸消失在稀薄的空氣中。

sentences.english: Indeed, Ceres may have ice caps and a thin atmosphere.
sentences.chinese: 實際上，穀神星可能有冰層覆蓋而且大氣稀薄。

sentences.english: Maybe the African forests thinned out.
sentences.chinese: 也許非洲森林變得稀薄。

sentences.english: Because the air is so cold and thin, the cabin has to be air-conditioned.
sentences.chinese: 由於空氣又冷又稀薄客艙必須進行空氣調節。

sentences.english: The trees had been thinned to increase aspen tree regeneration.
sentences.chinese: 樹林已經變得稀薄，增加了白楊樹的再生。

sentences.english: Unfolds with flavors of passion fruit, gooseberry and subtle herbaceousness.
sentences.chinese: 西番蓮果，醋栗口味，並略帶稀薄的草木香口感。

sentences.english: The liquid was thin and greyish brown.
The air molecules also attenuate to some degree the generation of an electromagnetic pulse.
sentences.chinese: 空氣分子也稀薄到可產生電磁脈衝的程度。
